titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of the President records ARCH148
titlestmt.author: Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from word document finding aid by Sean Parke in Dec. 2015. Word documents last updated in by Margaret Mair (Series I in Aug. 2011, Series II in Nov. 2013, and Series III in Nov. 2014). Updated and Revised by Sean Parke 2016.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-06-15 11:45:43 -0400.

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of Hartford. Office of the President

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Some files have been restricted due to their confidential content. A review of the files and restrictions in currently in progress.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of memos, correspondence, and working files created by the Office of the President of the University of Hartford primarily during the administrations of Humphrey Tonkin and Walter Harrison. The collection also contains a smaller amount of material generated during the tenure of Stephen Trachtenberg.

The files consist of various topics regarding the University of Hartford and its schools including capital campaigns, strategic planning, projects, initiatives, and events. University Presidents have also been prominent members of non-University organizations. Files regarding their activities in these organizations are included in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of notes, memorandums, correspondence, and reports of the Strategic Planning Committee (SPC) and the Strategic Planning Advisory Team (SPAT), as well as their respective sub-committees.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This file is arranged in rough chronological order.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: During reprocessing in March 2016, this file level was found out of order. The finding aid folder listing did not match the contents of the boxes, and neither had a consistent order. Folder names were not changed during reprocessing, but material was refoldered when necessary and attempted to put into the order which seemed to be the original processors intent. The folders included folder descriptions as part of the file name. While updating the finding aid, it was decided to consider all folders whose file name/contents started with "Strategic Planning - University SPC" or "Strategic Planning - University SPAT" to be one file level in the ArchivesSpace description.

did.unittitle: Strategic Planning - HCW - SPC Phase I
Strategic Planning - HCW - SPC Phase II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains information regarding: the Cosmos Club, Francine Z Trachtenberg, George Washington University (including inauguration and correspondence with Walter Harrison), Hebrew University, intercollegiate correspondence, media coverage, photos, speeches, Trachtenberg Fund, and University of Hartford HJG Center groundbreaking remarks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains: design plans, groundbreaking photos, the school's first yearbook, curriculum, as well as memorandums and studies regarding the creation and operation of the school.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file documents the creation of the University High School including the proposal to the Woodrow Wilson National Fellowship Foundation and the Memorandum of Agreement.
